title: Type2-Q1
prompt_html: A study recorded pine needle length (mm) for 11 individuals with the following sample values: 106, 112, 103, 106, 110, 109, 105, 105, 98, 114, 93. Assume the population is normally distributed and the data are a simple random sample. Using this information, construct a 90% confidence interval for the population mean. Round your answer to two decimals.
